attributes.action: Allow restaurant and hospitality workers to wear lash extensions.
attributes.additional_details: The probability for lash extensions to fall out unprovoked are very low- they are attached to your natural lash and the only way they fall out is when your real lash falls out during your natural lash cycle. If anything, a false lash would be easier to identify as a foreign object. Lashes help improve mental health, confidence and self love, they should be allowed in the work place and do not object to any health and safety regulations.
attributes.background: Change health and safety audits to allow people to wear lashes who work in hospitality/ restaurants. These workers are paid minimum wage and work most evenings and weekends, spending long hours at work. They should be allowed to feel confident and beautiful as lashes don’t effect health and safety.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

There are health and safety regulations about for handling food, but these do not specifically ban eyelash extensions. Decisions about detailed personal hygiene requirements are a matter for individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can read the Food Standards Agency guidance on personal hygiene here: https://www.food.gov.uk/business-guidance/personal-hygiene
